subject: Problems with classpath, junit.jar, and win98
msgSnippet: I have tried to put the junit.jar in the classpath using sysedit on the autoexec.bat and it says it cannot find it.  I have tried to rename the directory,

I have tried to put the junit.jar in the classpath using sysedit on
the autoexec.bat and it says it cannot find it.  I have tried to
rename the directory, unzip the junit.jar even.  It does work if I
unzip the jar file and run the program the long way: java
jhome.junit.swingui.TestRunner then the tested file.  It runs that way
but I want it to be available in my other directories.  I guess I
should say global.  Any suggestions?  As I said in the subject I am
still using win98.  I am cheap.  Thanks for your time.
